revised_title: Investigating the Role of Nucleolus in Nucleic Acid Synthesis
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using X-irradiation on tissue culture cells to study the role of the nucleolus in nucleic acid synthesis. They found that X-irradiation of the nucleolus reduces the amount of nucleic acid synthesized in the nucleus, while X-irradiation of the nuclear sap does not have the same effect. This research helps to understand the importance of the nucleolus in cellular synthetic activities.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
